content.text: La Poste‏ ‏ is a postal company offering services to people living in Metropolitan France. La Poste can also serve people living in ‏ ‏Monaco, Andorra, and Saint Pierre and Miquelon‏ ‏. Created in ‏ ‏1991‏ ‏, La Poste is one of the oldest and most popular postal services in France.‏

‏Many delivery services in France are privatized. La Poste stands out for continuing to ‏ ‏remain a public service‏ ‏ after telecommunications company France Télécom became privatized in 1997. La Poste is also united with the umbrella company ‏ ‏GeoPost‏ ‏. ‏

‏La Poste can ship packages internationally to 40 different countries, including many non-European countries. Countries in the Middle East, Asia, Africa, Oceania and North America can all get packages and mail from La Poste. In France, La Poste tracking is fast, and delivery can be completed in two days. ‏

‏They also offer services by ‏ ‏Colissimo‏ ‏. It lets you drop off a package at a La Poste location. Then a courier will collect the package and deliver it within two business days to anywhere in France. Colissimo can also ship packages internationally. ‏

‏La Poste can ship packages, letters and other mail locally and internationally. They have several ‏‏ready-to-post envelopes‏ ‏ that you can buy that make it easy to post mail without buying a stamp. ‏
‏Shipping packages is also easy with La Poste. They offer ‏ ‏various cardboard boxes‏ ‏ that range in size, with some including built-in bubble wrap. ‏

‏La Poste also offers services by ‏Colissimo‏. It lets you drop off a package at a La Poste location. Then a courier will collect the package then deliver it within two business days to anywhere in France. Colissimo can also ship packages internationally.

‏Frequently Asked Questions‏
‏Can I track a La Poste package without a tracking number?‏
‏You should wait a few days to get your tracking number when your package ships. Your tracking number may also be found on a ‏ ‏receipt‏ ‏or an SMS message. ‏

‏You can track your package without a tracking number if you're using the La Poste website. The ‏tracking page‏ ‏allows you to enter a "notice of package" if you don't have the tracking number for any reason. You will want to try and get the tracking number so you can use Circuit Package Tracker, which is more convenient and accurate. ‏

‏If you don't have your tracking number, you can get it in a few different ways. Whether it be local La Poste tracking in France or international La Poste tracking, they will be able to help you figure out the problem. You should contact La Poste customer service with all of the information you have to find your tracking number. ‏
‏You should have a‏ ‏confirmation email‏‏ that has any information you would need. You may also have some of this info in an SMS message. ‏
‏Does Circuit offer better tracking than La Poste?‏

‏Yes. Using Circuit is more straightforward than tracking your package using the La Poste website. Circuit Package Tracker is more convenient, and all you have to do is enter the tracking number and select "La Poste" as your courier. ‏

‏‏In general, Circuit Package Tracker has more accurate information than the La Poste website. It can also generate tracking information more quickly. In just a few seconds, you'll know where your package currently is and how far away it is. ‏

‏Circuit Package Tracker is especially the better option for La Poste international tracking. If you rely on just the La Poste website, they may run out of information once your package leaves France. Since Circuit has universal information, all courier information and shipment points are available, no matter where your package is currently. ‏
‏How late does La Poste deliver?‏

‏What time you get your package depends on if you chose to get your package quickly or if you're okay with standard delivery times. It is possible to have your package delivered at night. La Poste conveniently ‏delivers on Saturdays‏. Deliveries happen between Monday and Saturday.‏
‏How long does it usually take to deliver an international package with La Poste?‏

‏International delivery times depend on the country you're shipping to. Most International countries can expect to get packages within ‏ ‏4-8 business days‏. If you are tracking an international La Poste package, you can see how long it would take by typing in the country.‏

‏La Poste will make every effort to deliver your package within eight business days. If your package has still not arrived after 15 business days, you should contact La Poste customer service. Customer service representatives are available 8:30 am to 7:30 pm from Monday to Friday and 8:30 am to 1:00 pm on Saturdays. ‏
‏How long will La Poste hold a package?‏
‏La Poste will keep your package for ‏15 days‏. You can pick it up at the chosen La Poste pick-up point. You can assign someone to pick up your package if you're not able to. ‏
‏How to sign for a La Poste package‏
‏If you need to sign for your La Poste package, you should wait for it to arrive. The postal worker will knock on your door when they have arrived. You can sign for your package when they do.‏
‏If you're not home, the package will arrive at a La Poste pick-up location. You can come during business hours and sign for your package. Then you'll be able to take it home and enjoy it. ‏

‏Circuit Package Tracker takes away the stress of waiting around for a package. The up-to-date tracking information allows you to plan for when your package will arrive. Not knowing this tracking information can lead to the following issues: ‏
Waiting around for a package to arrive on a wrong day‏

‏What do I do if I haven't got my package from La Poste?‏
‏Your package may be delayed. You can try entering your tracking number into the Circuit Package tracker software. It will be able to tell you if a delay has occurred and where and why. ‏
‏What happens if La Poste loses my package?‏

‏First, you should double-check Circuit Package Tracker for any information about your package. It may be delayed and arrive at a later date. If you think La Poste has lost your package, you should contact customer service. ‏
‏What happens if I miss my La Poste delivery?‏

‏If you miss your La Poste delivery, your package will be sent to a pick-up location. You have 15 days to pick up the package at the pick-up location. You can assign someone to pick it up if you're not able to. ‏

‏We all get busy and may not be able to pick up a package. Assigning a friend or loved one to pick up a package is easy. They’ll have to present a piece of valid I.D and should bring up-to-date info about your package, like a confirmation email or La Poste tracking number. ‏
‏What time will my La Poste package arrive?‏

‏To know roughly what time your package will arrive, you can check your tracking information in Circuit Package Tracker. It offers La Poste tracking information in English as well. If your package is "out for delivery," you should stay home and wait for it to arrive that day. ‏
‏Where is my La Poste package?‏

‏Circuit Package Tracker knows that your time is precious. You shouldn't have to worry about your package and making phone calls to customer service. Simply entering your tracking number into Circuit Package Tracker will show you where your package is and how much longer you have to wait. ‏

‏It can be frustrating to be told that your package will be delivered within 15 days. If that is your only info, you may waste time waiting around for a delivery. You may also miss a delivery that requires a signature. ‏

‏Some people don't know how easy it is to find out where your package currently is. You may think it's as simple as receiving your package when it arrives or your loved one receiving the package you sent when it gets there. Those days are behind us with modern tracking services, including Circuit. ‏
‏Where is my La Poste tracking number?‏

‏Your tracking number can be found on a postal receipt or in a shipment confirmation email. When your package ships, you will then have access to the tracking number in your email. You may also get a text message with your tracking number. ‏
‏Why is my La Poste package not moving?‏

‏An international shipment may be ‏stopped at a border‏ ‏for several reasons. Movement can also be affected by poor weather conditions. Circuit Package Tracker can answer this question for you so you know what to do next. ‏
‏Circuit Package Tracker can detect if your package has been temporarily stalled. Your package may have also stopped moving for the following reasons:‏
Damaged items due to poor packaging‏
An address that is written poorly‏
‏An incomplete address ‏

‏If you don't think your package has shipped, you should contact La Poste as soon as possible. You should also contact them if your La Poste tracking hasn't been updated in a while in Circuit Package Tracker. Give them all the relevant details, including email confirmation and tracking number.‏
‏Why is my La Poste Package Pending?‏

‏A "pending" message in a tracking system means that La Poste and Circuit Package Tracker are aware of your delivery. It means that in the near future, your package will be shipped, and you will be able to track its progress. ‏

‏A pending message means that your shipment will be processed at a later date. If you continue to check and your package has still not shipped, you should contact La Poste customer service during their business hours.
